channel.title: CNET News
channel.description: CNET news editors and reporters provide top technology news, with investigative reporting and in-depth coverage of tech issues and events.

item.title: 5 great PlayStation VR games you've never heard of (but are about to) - CNET
item.description: PlayStation VR needs quirky games like these to fill out its launch lineup. Here are 5 of our favorites from Sony's E3 slate.
item.dc:creator: Ashley Esqueda

item.title: New Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild trailer will take your breath away - CNET
item.description: Breath of the Wild takes the popular game series into an open world of lush visuals, forest fires and glorious explosions.
item.dc:creator: Amanda Kooser

item.title: LifeBeam artificial intelligence headphones put a biosensing fitness coach in your ear - CNET
item.description: The newest wearable on Kickstarter is Vi, a pair of wireless headphones with 11 contextual sensors that adapt to your workouts and provides real-time fitness coaching.
item.dc:creator: Justin Yu

item.title: A crashed computer at the US Air Force wiped out a decade's worth of data - CNET
item.description: More than 100,000 internal investigations records dating back to 2004 have been lost, service officials say.
item.dc:creator: Ry Crist

item.title: E3 2016: Monday's biggest news - CNET
item.description: Here's everything that happened on the first day of this year's big event.
item.dc:creator: GameSpot Staff

item.title: GMC Acadia's Rear Seat Reminder caters to the idiots in our midst - Roadshow
item.description: If you're the type to accidentally leave living beings and perishable items inside a hot car, you need more help than a car can provide.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Krok

item.title: Unpacking WWDC: Did Apple wow you? (The 3:59, Ep. 61) - CNET
item.description: We discuss the highs and lows of Apple's developers conference, and touch on the Net neutrality news of the day.
item.dc:creator: Roger Cheng

item.title: At E3, Nintendo previews upcoming Zelda and Pokemon games (pictures) - CNET
item.description: Take a peak at Nintendo's The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild and Pokemon: Sun and Moon.
item.dc:creator: Lynn La

item.title: Children of the corn: Nissan develops world-first ethanol automotive fuel cell - Roadshow
item.description: Most fuel cells run on compressed hydrogen, but Nissan's unit relies on bioethanol, a gasoline alternative that can be sourced from plants.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Krok

item.title: Russian government hackers allegedly stole Democrats' research on Trump - CNET
item.description: The hackers allegedly gained access to the Democratic National Committee's network and snagged emails, chat transcripts and a database of political info on the likely Republican presidential nominee.
item.dc:creator: Laura Hautala

item.title: Meet the largest Star Wars Tatooine-like planet orbiting two suns - CNET
item.description: Kepler-1647b doesn't sport Tatooine's desert climate or a bunch of Jedi, but it does proudly orbit two suns.
item.dc:creator: Amanda Kooser

item.title: Apple to app makers: Come on in! OK, now stop right there - CNET
item.description: With iOS 10, third-party apps will work with iMessage, Maps, Siri and even the phone to make calls. But that openness has some limits.
item.dc:creator: Shara Tibken

item.title: The Los Angeles Auto Show wants to turbocharge your auto startup - Roadshow
item.description: Competition winners will be featured in the show's new AutoMobility LA program.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Krok

item.title: Wolf optical illusion shows Internet a howling good time - CNET
item.description: Sure, you've picked a side in the infamous dress debate and figured out the brick wall photo. But watch long enough, and this latest visual puzzle solves itself.
item.dc:creator: Gael Fashingbauer Cooper

item.title: Hulu acquires exclusive streaming rights to 'Roots' - CNET
item.description: After airing on History over Memorial Day weekend, the A&E Networks-produced miniseries is headed to Hulu this fall.
item.dc:creator: Ry Crist

item.title: Best Buy trims up to $30 off Fitbit activity trackers - CNET
item.description: All of the Fitbit Charge HR models are on sale, saving you anywhere from $20 to $30.
item.dc:creator: Lance Whitney

item.title: T-Mobile's newest Binge On expansion adds in Elmo - CNET
item.description: Along with PBS, you can expect to find Azubu, Dailymotion Games and Eyegroove in the carrier's lineup of services you can stream without burning through your data plan.
item.dc:creator: Ry Crist

item.title: FCC's Net neutrality rules win big in appeals court - CNET
item.description: Internet service providers had sued the agency in an attempt to overturn the rules, which they argued are too much of a burden.
item.dc:creator: Marguerite Reardon

item.title: Snapchat's set to start sneaking ads into your stories - CNET
item.description: The immensely popular video messaging app is launching "Snapchat Partners" in an effort to expand its appeal to advertisers.
item.dc:creator: Ry Crist

item.title: Far out, man: Lego goes full flower child with VW Beetle kit - Roadshow
item.description: This is the latest automotive addition to the Creator set, which uses traditional blocks instead of the more complicated Technic pieces.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Krok

item.title: Fitness trackers still hot, but smartwatches catching on - CNET
item.description: Smartwatches are gaining in popularity with people who want more-advanced tracking for exercise, according to research firm NPD Group.
item.dc:creator: Lance Whitney

item.title: Twitter tackles trolls with a better block button - CNET
item.description: The updated block feature will now prevent anyone you've blocked from sneaking into your feed when someone else retweets them, or vice versa.
item.dc:creator: Ry Crist

item.title: French terror suspect kills two outside Paris, broadcasts attack on Facebook Live - CNET
item.description: After killing a police commander Monday night, Larosi Abballa took the victim's partner and son hostage and broadcast to Facebook Live from inside the home.
item.dc:creator: Ry Crist

item.title: Nintendo E3 2016 live stream: Watch here at 9 a.m. PT, noon ET, 5 p.m. UK - CNET
item.description: Watch Nintendo's complete E3 2016 live stream right here -- but don't expect any news on the company's NX console.
item.dc:creator: CNET staff

item.title: 'Crowd Control,' part 17: Back to hell on Earth like a bat out of heaven - CNET
item.description: In the latest installment of CNET's crowdsourced science fiction novel, three heroes finally join forces to level the playing field between heaven and Earth.
item.dc:creator: Eric Mack and contributors
